org.jgrapes.core

Interface Component

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractComponent, HandlingErrorPrinter

    public interface Component
    Marks a class as a component. Implementing this interface is an alternative to deriving a component from AbstractComponent (usually because there is some other preferential inheritance relationship).

    Components aren't required to implement specific methods. They must, however, declare a field for an associated manager. This field must be of type Manager and annotated as ComponentManager. The implementation of the component can use the value in this field to get access to the component hierarchy. The field is initialized when the component is added to the component hierarchy or when calling Utils.manager(Component).

    Author:
    Michael N. Lipp
